bn.base

Class Distribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • bn.util.ArrayMap<Value,java.lang.Double>
        • bn.base.Distribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Distribution, java.util.Map<Value,java.lang.Double>

    public class Distribution
extends ArrayMap<Value,java.lang.Double>
implements Distribution
    Base implementation of a Distribution as an ArrayMap from Values to Doubles. AIMA uses arrays indexed by the values of the variable. We use a Map whose keys are the values. One could instead map the values to integer indexes (by imposing an ordering on them), and then use an array of doubles to represent the distribution. That might be nice since one can't put primitive doubles in a Map...

    • Constructor Detail

      • Distribution

        public Distribution(RandomVariable X)
        Construct and return a new empty Distribution for the given RandomVariable. Note that we don't actually enforce that the values in the Distribution are only those for the RandomVariable. But anyway, this is handy.
